intro: Talinum guadalupense, commonly known as the Guadalupense spinach, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds. Talinum guadalupense is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
